intro: Ajuga arabica, commonly known as Persian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 15–30 centimeters, featuring a spreading rhizomatous root system. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers in early summer, which are borne on slender, upright stems. Its lance-shaped leaves are arranged in a basal rosette and are often hairy to the touch. Ajuga arabica is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
